      • grammarWithExtraStartSymbol

        public Grammar grammarWithExtraStartSymbol()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a grammar that is identical to this, except that is has a new start symbol that produces the old start symbol. For example, if the old grammar is "S > A, A > B", then the new grammar is "newS > S, S > A, A > B"
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
